ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.2_0: Because of decline in material support and loss of respect, Devadatta and his followers were only invited to meals after repeatedly asking.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.3_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics eat at invitations after repeatedly asking?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.5_0: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.6_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.8_0: “How can Devadatta and his followers eat at invitations after repeatedly asking?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.9_0: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.12_0: “... Foolish man, how can you and your followers eat at invitations after repeatedly asking?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.15.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.16_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.1_0: Soon afterwards people invited sick monks to a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.2_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.4_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.5_0: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.6_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.7.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.8_0: This is the appropriate occasion: he is sick.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.9_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.1_0: Soon afterwards, during the robe-giving season, people prepared a meal together with robe-cloth and then invited the monks, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.2_0: intending to offer the robes after giving the meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.4_0: As a result they only obtained a small amount of robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.5_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.6_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group during the robe-giving season.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.7_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.8.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.9_0: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.10_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.1_0: Soon afterwards people invited monks for a meal at a time when they were making robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.2_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.3_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.4_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group at a time when you are making robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.5_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.6.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.7_0: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.8_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.1_0: Soon afterwards monks went traveling with some people.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.2_0: the other monks said to that family,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.6_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.7_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.8_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when you’re traveling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.9_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.10.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.11_1: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.12_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.1_0: Soon afterwards monks boarded a boat with some people.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.2_0: Those monks said to the people, “We’ll go to the village for alms.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.4_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.5_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.6_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when you’re traveling by boat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.7_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.8.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.9_1: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling by boat; he is traveling by boat.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.10_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.1_0: Soon afterwards monks who had completed the rainy-season residence in various regions were coming to Rājagaha to visit the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.2_0: People saw those monks who had come from various countries, and they invited them for a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.3_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.4_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.5_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group on big occasions.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.6_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.7.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.8_1: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is traveling by boat; it is a big occasion; it is a big occasion; it is a big occasion.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.9_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1_0: At one time a relative of King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha who had gone forth with the Ājīvaka ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1_1: He then went to King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1_2: and after approaching the King said, “Great king, I wish to make a meal for the ascetics of all meals.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.2_0: “That’s fine, Sir, if you first feed the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.4_0: And he sent a message to the monks: “Please accept a meal from me tomorrow.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.5_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.6_0: Then that Ājīvaka ascetic went to the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.6_1: exchanged greetings with the Buddha and stood to one side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.7_0: “Good Gotama has gone forth and so have I.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.8_0: One who has gone forth is worthy of receiving alms from another who has gone forth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.9_0: Would Master Gotama together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.10_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.11_0: The Ājīvaka understood that the Buddha had consented, and he left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.12_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.13_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group at a time when you are designated as meals.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.15.1_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.16_1: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is traveling by boat; it is a big occasion; it is a meal given by an ascetic.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.2_0: wherever four monks, after being invited, eat any of the five staple foods—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.2_1: this is called “eats in a group”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.3_0: Except if it is an appropriate occasion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.4_0: unless it is an appropriate occasion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.6_0: even if he just has cracked feet, he may eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.8_0: if he has not participated in the robe-making procedure, he may eat in a group during the last month of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.8_1: If he has participated in the robe-making procedure, he may eat in a group during the five month period.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.9_0: It is a time of making robes:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.10_0: when he is making robes, he may eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.12_0: if he intends to travel at least six kilometers, he may eat in a group. And he may eat in a group while he is traveling, and after traveling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.14_0: if he intends to board a boat, he may eat in a group. And he may eat in a group while on-board, and after disembarking.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.16_0: if two or three monks can get by by walking for alms, but not a group of four,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.16_1: If he eats it, he may eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.17_0: It is a meal given by an ascetic:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.18_0: if any kind of wanderer is making the meal, he may eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.19_0: If he receives it intending to eat it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.20_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.1_0: If it is a group meal, and he perceives it as such, and he eats, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.2_0: If it is a group meal, but he is unsure of it, and he eats, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.3_0: If it is a group meal, but he does not perceive it as such, and he eats it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.4_0: If it is not a group meal, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.5_0: If it is not a group meal, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.6_0: If it is not a group meal, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.3_0: eat one part of the three kinds of eating.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.4_0: if they eat together after walking for alms;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.5_0: if it is a regular meal invitation;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.9_0: if it is on the day after the observance day;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.10_0: if it is anything apart from the five kinds of staple food;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.12_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.13_0: The second rule, the training rule on group meals, is finished.
